channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: The Australian Human Rights Commission has been granted leave to intervene in a sexual harassment case involving a former air traffic control trainee and Airservices Australia.
item.title: Human Rights Commission to intervene in Airservices 'Mr Mintie' case

item.dc:creator: Zach Hope
item.description: After a lull in the late '90s and 2000s, sports trading cards - including AFL - are selling through the roof.
item.title: 'Gas in it yet': Trading cards hot again as '90s kids return to the game

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Her music career took off after winning Australian Idol in 2007, and was recently on The Voice. Natalie Gauci is now using her time in the public eye to speak about her alleged sexual abuse at the hands of someone she trusted. Â
item.title: Former Australian Idol winner launches legal action over alleged abuse

item.dc:creator: Nicholas Reece
item.description: While the 1990s recession caused mountains of human misery it also sparked new ideas and initiatives for Melbourne. It was a classic case of a crisis creating an opportunity for reforms that otherwise may not have been possible.
item.title: How would a looming recession reshape Melbourne?

item.description: Surrounded day after day by forelock tuggers and door openers, it is a rare politician who does not develop a surreal relationship with the very citizens they are there to help.
item.title: An overwhelming sense of entitlement is the rot at the core

item.description: If you are the owner of a beloved pooch, just remember that not everyone loves your dog as much as you do.
item.title: No, I do not love your dog

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: You must consider what you would do if the worst should happen: total loss by fire, flood or theft.
item.title: How I cut my home insurance premium in half

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: Carlton, the Brisbane Lions, Collingwood and Sydney finished a Saturday full of incredible AFL action in the winners' circle.
item.title: As it happened: Carlton Blues, Brisbane Lions, Collingwood Magpies and Sydney Swans victorious

item.dc:creator: Andrew Stafford
item.description: The Brisbane Lions have rolled over the top of the West Coast Eagles at the Gabba for their second win of the season, kicking eight goals to three in a dominant second half.
item.title: Lions prevail as West Coast's hub hurt continues

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Carlton have shocked Geelong with an upset victory at GMHBA Stadium to record their first win at the venue since 1996, handing the Cats just their fifth loss in their past 35 starts on their home deck.
item.title: Blues hang on in thriller as Cats comeback falls short

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: The TV shows 'Mrs America' and 'Made in Italy' depict different ends of the 1970s power dressing spectrum that feel as relevant today.
item.title: The nostalgic trend making a return to your winter wardrobe

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: From world music to radical storytelling, First Nations history to unique online performances, we have your week covered.
item.title: Best of the week: what to see, hear and do in Sydney from June 21-27

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: The angel-voiced singer tells us what she's been up to at home recently.
item.title: Home Sweet Home: How vocalist Vika Bull is keeping busy

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Monday, June 22

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Superquiz and Target, Sunday, June 21

item.dc:creator: Melissa Browne
item.description: Whether you put your mortgage repayments on hold or grabbed a chunk of your super using the government's financial hardship provisions, it's still possible to reverse those actions if you don't need the cash.
item.title: It's not too late to change your mind on COVID-19 relief

item.description: If you insist on choosing your own investments, perhaps you should compare independently managed accounts versus wraps.
item.title: Breaking down the fee structure of wrap accounts

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: Turn the old monorail stations into bars, fix the Cooks River cycleway and do something - anything - with White Bay.
item.title: Shovel ready, you say? Six recession-busting projects to spruce up Sydney

item.dc:creator: Adam Liaw
item.description: Some dishes take a bit more effort but they're worth it.
item.title: Adam Liaw: The perfect warming lasagne

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: It might not feel like it right now, but this is by no means a bad result for Parramatta. The gap between the pacesetters and the premiers isnât as big as many thought.
item.title: 'The clash it should have been': Roosters storm home to beat Eels in game of year

item.description: Jesse Hoganâs long-awaited AFL return wonât be a pretty sight after the star Fremantle forward suffered an unlucky facial injury on Friday.
item.title: It wonât be pretty, but Hogan poised to return

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: Meanwhile, services between Circular Quay and Randwick will be reduced to 15-20 minutes on Saturday evening, a statement from light rail operator Transdev said.Â
item.title: Major light rail services suspended after fire alarm activation

item.description: The deaths of four Victoria Police officers in the Eastern Freeway tragedy had a ripple affect on the police community. Many questioned their faith, but kind acts by strangers gave some great comfort.
item.title: On a tragedy that tested our faith

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: The AFL is set to probe whether Essendon's Conor McKenna has breached the league's strict protocols for COVID-19 following his positive test to the virus.
item.title: AFL to investigate whether McKenna breached COVID-19 protocols

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The government is right to tackle the jobs crisis with increased university funding for courses that have strong job prospects, but it is wrong to target humanities.
item.title: Donât rob Peter to pay for Paul on uni places

item.dc:creator: Jane Rocca
item.description: The choir master is carrying on his mother's work by raising his two great-nephews.
item.title: 'Life has come full circle': Jonathon Welch on his biggest influences

item.description: Plus, the equestrian champion reveals the designer blazer she has in four different colours.
item.title: Elegance and femininity: How Edwina Tops-Alexander dresses for comfort

item.dc:creator: Jane Caro
item.description: We yearn to see our world clean and bright and bursting with a variety of life. Yet we humans weigh very heavily on the landscape.
item.title: During COVID-19, nature has taught us what we need to do to help it

item.description: Free weekly horoscope for each star sign from renowned astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the week ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Weekly Horoscope for June 21 - 28

item.dc:creator: Nicole Economos
item.description: The multidisciplinary designer and mother shares her day on a plate.
item.title: My Day on a Plate: Rachel Burke

item.dc:creator: Jane Rocca
item.description: She may be approaching 70, but Chrissie Hynde will not let age â or a pandemic â slow her down.
item.title: 'The emphasis on celebrity is grotesque': Chrissie Hynde, rock goddess

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Nathan Buckley had nothing but praise for his frontline ruckman on a night he took on two specialist opponents and still won.
item.title: Solo mission a 'badge of honour' for Grundy: Buckley

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Western BulldogsÂ forward Aaron Naughton was cleared of rough conduct after Giants star Lachie Whitfield was left concussed on Friday night.
item.title: Naughton cleared, 15 fined for Dogs, Giants melee

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: The renewed A-League TV deal with Fox Sports is worth about $25 million less per season but will give FFA broadcast rights of the FFA Cup and digital assets.
item.title: FFA cops big broadcast cash blow but claims FFA Cup and digital wins

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Jim Pavlidis
item.description: Ancient footy fans still struggle to accept the gameâs climate has changed, and that the rules for some teams need to be different.
item.title: It's been a big week in art ... with Jim Pavlidis

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Around midday, Gillon McLachlan received a call from his head legal counsel Andrew Dillon with the news that he and the AFL had been braced for throughout this vexed AFL season.
item.title: High noon call brings news AFL has been dreading

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The Tigers held on for another victory - but coach Michael Maguire and the fans know it could have been so much more.
item.title: 'Filthy with themselves': Tigers limp home against Cowboys despite huge half-time lead

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Most of his Souths teammates were unaware he needed to be consoled by coach Wayne Bennett after the 40-12 thrashing of the New Zealand Warriors.
item.title: Biosecurity ban on seeing family takes toll on tearful Latrell

item.dc:creator: Timna Jacks
item.description: Local mayors are urging the Andrews government to consider targeting increased restrictions at specific COVID-19 outbreak locations rather than locking down an entire local government area.
item.title: Mayors warn against lockdowns for entire local government areas

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: The NSW government was warned more than six months ago to urgently improve its cyber security in a report that found almost half of its agencies had no recommended strategies in place to prevent attacks.
item.title: NSW government was warned over cyber security weaknesses

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 21, 2020

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Collingwood managed only five goals last week but didn't have any issues against St Kilda with a strong win at the MCG on Saturday.
item.title: Magpies make a statement as Saints fail their test

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Essendon are reeling from the news that defender Conor McKenna has tested positive to COVID-19 and are awaiting direction from the AFL and health officials.
item.title: Essendon uncertain what lies ahead as a result of McKenna testing positive to COVID-19

item.description: An eight-race card in the NSW Central West wraps up the week for Racing NSW.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Coonamble on Sunday

item.dc:creator: The Age's View
item.description: It is so often such cultural touchstones as the arts that throw up the champions of our age.
item.title: Don't rob Peter to pay for Paul on uni places

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Champion James McDonald had a dirty day at Randwick. He didn't ride a winner and was the centre of stewards' attention for his ride on Threeood.
item.title: 'Half-hearted': Stewards grill McDonald after promising day turns sour

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Elite private college Camberwell Grammar School is contacting parents of pupils who may have come into contact with a year 7 student who tested positive for coronavirus and attended school while infectious.
item.title: Two aged care homes in lockdown as dozens of new cases put Victorians on high alert
